__e: My father, who was Irish, was sent to work at the age of 11.
When I was a boy, my pa told me... that I was lucky to have an Irish pa and an Indian ma.
No, you are not telling that joke, what's Irish and stays outside?
I got a fine Irish kid that could turn pro for the opener.
I mean, that's the luck of the irish we have right there.
Even now stood next to an Irishman you know yet little, an Irishman you've been very kind to... but still a man who is of the same race of the men who lynched your boys.
